trans-unit.source: Interacts with the parser to build a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> control.
This class is used primarily for control developers.
To create a custom control builder for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> derived control, you need to inherit from this class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemControlBuilder"></xref> class.
Determines whether white spaces in the text associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> are represented by <xref href="System.Web.UI.LiteralControl"></xref> objects.

This method overrides the inherited implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.AllowWhitespaceLiterals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to always indicate that white spaces in the text associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control are not represented by <xref:System.Web.UI.LiteralControl?displayProperty=fullName> objects.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> for all cases.
Determines whether HTML entities in the text associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> are converted to their equivalent characters when the text is parsed.

The HtmlDecodeLiterals method is used to determine whether HTML entities in the text associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> are converted to their equivalent characters when the text is parsed.
This method overrides the inherited implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.HtmlDecodeLiterals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to always return `true`.
This indicates that HTML entities in the text associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control are always automatically converted to their equivalent, plain text characters.
> [!NOTE] > The text associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> is rendered as an attribute of the `<option>` HTML element.
When the attribute is rendered on the client, special characters are automatically converted to their equivalent HTML entity.
For example, the less than character (<) is converted to `<`.
When the attribute is parsed, HTML entities are automatically converted back to their equivalent, plain text characters.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> for all cases.
